For example, if we look at trees near the snowline of a mountain, then because storms tend to break over peaks, those trees will get all the water they need; the limiting factor on growth will be temperature, which will therefore determine the width of the growth rings.
data.fullContent: Another difficulty is that we would expect both the temperature and the amount of rainfall to affect the growth of trees. We would ideally like a proxy for one or the other, whereas when we measure the width of a growth ring we are looking at the combined effects of both. One way around this is to study what are known as limiting stands. For example, if we look at trees near the snowline of a mountain, then because storms tend to break over peaks, those trees will get all the water they need; the limiting factor on growth will be temperature, which will therefore determine the width of the growth rings.
data.answer: 另一个困难是，我们预计温度和降雨量都会影响树木的生长。理想情况下，我们想要一个或另一个的代理，而当我们测量一个生长环的宽度时，我们是在观察两者的综合效应。解决这个问题的一种方法是研究所谓的限制立场。例如，如果我们观察山脉雪线附近的树木，那么因为暴风雨往往会越过山峰，这些树木将得到它们需要的所有水;生长的限制因素是温度，因此温度将决定生长环的宽度。
